alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Pottawatomie (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 3:02PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Pottawatomie and southwestern Jackson Counties through 345 PM CDT... At 259 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Emmett, moving southeast at 15 mph. An additional thunderstorm was located 6 miles northwest of Emmett, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Emmett and Delia. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
